reactJSList.question: Q1. If you want to import just the Component from the React library, what syntax do you use?
Q2. If a function component should always render the same way given the same props, what is a simple performance optimization available for it?
answerOption: Wrap it in the `React.memo` higher-order component.
reactJSList.realAnswer: Wrap it in the `React.memo` higher-order component.

reactJSList.question: 22. When might you use `React.PureComponent`?
answerOption: when you do not want your component to have props
when you have sibling components that need to be compared
when you want a default implementation of `shouldComponentUpdate()
when you do not want your component to have state
reactJSList.realAnswer: when you want a default implementation of `shouldComponentUpdate()`

reactJSList.question: 23. Why is it important to avoid copying the values of props into a component's state where possible?
answerOption: because you should never mutate state
because `getDerivedStateFromProps()` is an unsafe method to use
because you want to allow a component to update in response to changes in the props
because you want to allow data to flow back up to the parent
reactJSList.realAnswer: because you want to allow a component to update in response to changes in the props

reactJSList.question: 24. What is the children prop?
answerOption: a property that adds child components to state
a property that lets you pass components as data to other components
a property that lets you set an array as a property
a property that lets you pass data to child elements
reactJSList.realAnswer: a property that lets you pass components as data to other components

reactJSList.question: Q38. What is sent to an `Array.map()` function?
answerOption: a callback function that is called once for each element in the array

the number of times you want to call the function

reactJSList.realAnswer: a callback function that is called once for each element in the array

reactJSList.question: Q39. Why is it a good idea to pass a function to `setState` instead of an object?

setState is asynchronous and might result in out of sync values.
reactJSList.realAnswer: setState is asynchronous and might result in out of sync values.

Q48. Which answer best describes a function component?
answerOption: A function component is the same as a class component.
A function component accepts a single props object and returns a React element.
A function component is the only way to create a component.
A function component is required to create a React component.
reactJSList.realAnswer: A function component accepts a single props object and returns a React element.

reactJSList.question: Q49. Which library does the `fetch()` function come from?
answerOption: No library. `fetch()` is supported by most browsers.
reactJSList.realAnswer: No library. `fetch()` is supported by most browsers.

answerOption: It will cause an error immediately.
It will execute the code inside the function, but only after waiting to ensure that no other component is accessing the name variable.
It will update the value of name once and not run again until name is changed from the outside.
It will cause an infinite loop.
reactJSList.realAnswer: It will update the value of name once and not run again until name is changed from the outside.

reactJSList.question: Q51. Which choice will not cause a React component to rerender?

reactJSList.question: Q67. Why should you use React Router's Link component instead of a basic `<a>` tag in React?
answerOption: The link component allows the user to use the browser's `Back` button.
There is no difference--the `Link` component is just another name for the `<a>` tag.
The `<a>` tag will cause an error when used in React.
The `<a>` tag triggers a full page reload, while the `Link` component does not.
reactJSList.realAnswer: The `<a>` tag triggers a full page reload, while the `Link` component does not.

reactJSList.realAnswer: the element that should be created
